introduction: The Core Reference System (CRS) provides a framework for understanding and organizing knowledge.
This article will explore how simple rulesets can be used to combine concepts in the CRS.

structure.title: **Applications of Simple Rulesets in the CRS**
subsections: Subsection 2.1: Combining ontological and taxonomical concepts
Subsection 2.2: Using simple rulesets for knowledge integration

structure.title: **Challenges and Opportunities of Combination**
subsections: Subsection 3.1: Limitations of simple rulesets in combination
Subsection 3.2: Potential benefits of combining complex concepts

conclusion: Summary of the importance of combining concepts using simple rulesets in the CRS.
Future directions for research and applications.
